David A. Saunders
Senior Instructor
Counterterrorism Division
Off:912-261-3672
Cell:912-944-7908
david.a.saunders@fletc.dhs.gov
status:
Discussed conducting a private ATO program at FLETC on 10/3/2022. Last message to Saunders:
-------------------
Regarding costs, for private groups with a hosted venue site, pricing is based on $12,000 per course (5-days/40-hours) plus expenses. If it was International, there would be an added fee for travel time but not relevant with a short trip to GA. I can accommodate up to 25 students in an ATO course. 

So if it were contracted, we’d estimate the expenses and provide an inclusive rate (probably somewhere around $15,000 including expenses for GA). If the arrangement was to price for individual tuition, we would probably suggest a pricing model at $1,500 per student and a 10 student minimum. If the host is confident they can deliver a larger audience, that price can be lowered. In the end, what matters is that we arrive at a minimum of $15,000 gross for the course.

For organizations that want to host multiple sessions, we adjust that pricing according to scale. For example, Amazon recently requested a series of six sessions and we adjusted the base price to $11,000 per week (excluding expenses).

project_name: Critical Response Skills Training for WCU Security Officers
status: Sent proposal on 28 February 2023.
description:
CIS-WCU Critical Response Skills for Security Officers (CRSSO) course is a two-day program
designed to prepare armed security officers for the critical task of tactically responding to active
shooter events on WCU facilities. The program also provides an understanding of the pathway to
targeted violence, pre-incident warning behaviors, and the basic principles of threat assessment to
prepare security officers for a proactive role in supporting WCU’s future threat assessment program.

status:
10/05/2023 - Was advised that they decided to engage us as their school consultants. Craig needs to prepare a proposal for design asssistane for three new schools in VA. 

Spoke with Danielle Davis on 21 August 2023 and provided information for them to submit as a vendor for a new school design project in Roanoke County Public Schools in VA.
description:
New school design review and possibly emergency response plan development and faculty training. Following is pricing from my last communication:

1.	Cost per Hour ( if you were to do hourly)
Professional Services: $240.00 per hour
Travel & Admin: $182.00 per hour
2.	Cost on a per project basis for the attached example project.  (48,000 sqft 2 story building) 
a.	Review
I estimate the review and a Q&A (Zoom meeting) would be approximately 12 hours bringing the price to $2,880.00. This price assumes that documents will be provided as specifically requested to minimize unnecessary time.
b.	Report 
Preparing a written report of recommendations and specifications based on the sample school is approximately 28 hours (including a risk assessment for NFPA 72 compliance as a separate document). The price would be $6,720.00.
c.	Coordination / Specification review 
I expect this will largely depend on the degree of follow up required by your team after receiving my report. For budgeting purposes, conservatively estimate 8 hours. Thus bringing the price to $1,920.
d.	Provide a security plan for action in emergency/ daily operation. 
Preparation of school emergency response plans is normally priced at $8,750. 
3.	Cost for onsite training for school security staff and administration (with-in the NC area) 
On-site emergency response training for school faculty is usually around $7,500 including travel expenses.

----------------
We have 3 projects we would like for your team to provide proposals on: 
1.	Pamlico County 6-12 – 
a.	Currently in Design Development 
b.	Contact: Miyuki Keller 

2.	Robinson – 
a.	Out to Bid 
b.	Contact : Michael Holborn (cced)

3.	Hoke High School – 
a.	Out to Bid 
b.	Contact : Michael Holborn (cced)

description: Our firm represents the Defendant in a negligent security/premises liability action involving a shooting that occurred at 10610 N. 30th Street, Tampa, FL 33612 in the case of Candis Pearson, as natural mother and guardian of W. L. IV, a minor v. Palm Residences LLC d/b/a Palm Avenue Apartments, LLC, Case No.: 22-CA-10170. We would like to retain a security expert to perform a site inspection of the property and serve as a defense expert witness in matters of premises security to challenge Plaintiff's allegations of liability. If you are able to serve as an expert witness in this case following a conflict check, we would request that you please send us your curriculum vitae and fee schedule for our client's consideration. description:
QUOTED TERMS:
•	Professional services are billed at a rate of $250 per hour
•	Travel time is billed at a rate of $175 per hour
•	Travel expenses will be billed at direct cost plus a $100 per day, per diem fee for travel incidentals
•	Billing will be rendered bi-weekly while activity is in progress, or upon completion of milestone activities (with understanding that there will be periods where our services are not necessary).

----------------------------
Email from client:
Hello, my firm Studio SOGO has just completed the schematic design of a 2-phase 30,000 SF early childhood learning facility on an existing campus in DeKalb County, GA. We are looking for a team to consult with regarding the security/safety of the school and how it directs our design. In addition, the school administration would like to do an overall deep dive into their current campus security. These may be two separate proposals - one for the design team and one for the school admin. Is there a time we can set up a call to discuss this? thanks!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

project_name: Flat Creek Baptist Church - Security Assessmenet
status:
Hector had a conversation with a member of their security team who has been tasked with exploring our services. Their objective is to establish a security team, prompted by their insurance company's requirement for a security assessment. Although unaware of the specific insurance company they use, their literature mentions CIS as a recommended resource for clients, possibly HAI. Hector emailed the individual, providing details on report deliverables and information on how CIS caters to churches. The recipient intends to present this information to their board for consideration regarding a formal proposal.

Hector did note that they typically charge between $9,000 - and $12,000 for these projects, depending on the size of the grounds and scope of work.
